intro: Monnina huallagensis, commonly known as Huallangeni monnina, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. Monnina huallagensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
